utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, I'm just coming in here today because I've been just on wall recently over the last, I would say three to four days. I started getting these like really bad muscle pains all throughout my body and then over the past few days I've also been feeling chilly, so uhm, I wonder if I have a fever and I've also just been having this cough for the last few days as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, what started first?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think the muscle pain started first and then it was the coughing then since yesterday, I think I might have a fever as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. The cough started ,or the muscle aches started first. Was that two days ago, three days ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Almost four days ago now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Four days, OK, and the cough started when?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Cough started three days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Uhm before the muscle aches started, did you like do anything different in your life, like you know, do a lot of exercise or any other strenuous activities?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I I haven't really changed my routine at all.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and where specifically like wha, which muscles ache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Pretty much like throughout my body, but I would say more so like upper back, my thighs, then my arms, yeah, kind of just all over.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK any joint pains as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And is it hard for you to walk like use your arms? Do you have any sort of like motor weakness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, it's not, I I can walk and there's no issues, but I I do feel like just overall general weakness. I don't know if that's to do with the pain or just feeling unwell.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you're able to do those things. You just feel like maybe you're tired?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any numbness or tingling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. The cough, is it a dry cough or like productive cough? Are you bringing up phlegm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's a dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: A dry cough, OK. Uhm, so no sputum or blood, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you have a runny nose or stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Wheeziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: And I have been feeling chilly over the last few days, just, I have been wearing like multiple layers having to put on an extra blanket so I might have been having a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, but you haven't taken your temperature, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Changes in your hair, nails or skin like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I've noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh sorry. Now that you mention I, I think taste a little bit today, I realized I was I wasn't really able to taste my breakfast.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So a little bit of change there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any feelings of like feel like feeling like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, how about uh like calf pain when you do a lot of walking?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Fainting or dizziness spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes to your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no nausea or vomiting.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh how about appetite changes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, appetites been the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, alright so are you otherwise healthy or do you have any longstanding medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, otherwise I've been pretty well haven't even really had to go to the doctor much in the past few years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good. And then, any hospitalizations or surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And how about medications, are you on any?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no medications.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about allergies, do you have any?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that just like uh, seasonal allergies I sometimes get just itchy eyes and runny nose, sneezing in the springtime.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do your current symptoms feel like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I feel completely different.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any family history of lung or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, think my uncle had a heart attack in his 50s.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: And I think my father has high blood pressure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, any cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And then do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, just socially sometimes when I'm with friends, not-nothing regular.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so for the past like two months, how often have you been smoking?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably a couple cigarettes on the weekend. We usually smoke marijuana, so not not too much like tobacco or cigarettes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. Uhm, do you do any other recreational drugs like marijuana, cocaine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just marijuana, no other drugs.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you smoke it or edibles.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Smoke it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how often do you smoke cannabis?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably just when I'm meeting up with friends. So every weekend I would say.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Every weekend?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And then how about an alcohol, do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I drink alcohol probably a couple of drinks every few days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. And sorry what kind of alcohol do you drink every few days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just mostly beers, maybe whiskey sometimes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how much of that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So probably a couple beers. Uhm every few days and then whiskey, maybe a normal glass every few days, so yeah I would say 3 or 4 beers a week and then maybe 2 glasses of whiskey. In a, in an average week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Alright, and have you been in touch with or in contact with anyone sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no one's been sick. Uhm I do meet up with some friends on the weekends. Some of them are from work, some of them are just that that I know outside of work.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, uhm and have any of them been sick or have they all been pretty healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, in heard from anyone that's been sick. We we kind of have a rule that if you know if we feel sick then not to, not to show up just because, like you know, when we're when we're drinking and like smoking, we may share like a joint, so it's not like we don't want to get everyone sick if one person is sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure. Uhm, that makes sense. Alright, any travel recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And where do you live right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right now I just live in an apartment by myself just outside of London.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any old carpets, dust, mold, asbestos anything that could make your condition worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so those are all the questions that I had for you. Did you have any questions of your own for myself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I don't think so, I just wanted to see what this might be.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. Uhm so, we are going to do a Covid swab on you because a lot of your symptoms do align with those of Covid, so we just want to rule that out first, so you should hear back in about 24 to 48 hours. Uhm, in the meantime you should isolate for two weeks and if it's not Covid, it could be another viral infection that's been going around this time of year. Either way, kind of management plan is the same, so make sure you're hydrated, eat well, sleep well, and if your symptoms become worse, severe or there any red flags like you have neurological symptoms, like seizures or weakness where you can move your limbs, you should seek help from the ER. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK. That sounds good. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
